Security: Keys that affect Windows security, permissions, and access control.
Startup: Programs and services that start with Windows.
Network: Settings related to network configuration and behavior.
User Interface: Visual and personalization settings for Windows.
System Core: Low-level system settings, services, and drivers.
Updates: Windows Update and patching related settings.
Performance: Settings that affect system responsiveness and performance.
Power: Controls power management, sleep, hibernate, and related options.
Explorer: Settings for Windows Explorer, file visibility, and folder behavior.
Accessibility: Ease of Access and input-related configurations.
Privacy: Telemetry, data collection, and app permission settings.
Compatibility: Legacy application support and compatibility mode behaviors.
Input: Keyboard, mouse, touchpad, and input behavior settings.
Services: Configurations related to Windows and third-party service behaviors.
Audio: System sound settings and audio device behaviors.
Time: Regional, time zone, and clock synchronization settings.
Printing: Printer spooler, driver, and queue management keys.
Display: Monitor, screen resolution, and scaling configuration keys.
Storage: Disk, volume, and filesystem-level configuration keys.
Applications: App registration, default programs, and installed software behaviors.
Misc: Miscellaneous registry entries that do not fit other categories.
